citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The facility’s IACUC did not review the facility's program for humane care and use of animals, inspect the animal facilities,
and submit reports to the Institutional Official at the required frequency of at least once every six months. The facility
conducted their semi-annual IACUC reviews and inspections in January 2022 and May 2023, which occurred at a 16-
month interval. These IACUC functions are necessary to ensure appropriate oversight of the care and use of animals
involved in research activities. The IACUC must review their program, inspect their animal facilities, and report the
findings to the Institutional Official at least once every six months.
Correct by November 24, 2023.

The facility's annual report for the previous 2022 federal fiscal year was not submitted by the required deadline of
December 1 to the Deputy Administrator. The facility submitted their annual report on May 25, 2023. Appropriate
submission of the annual report in a timely manner is essential to evaluate the information provided in the reports and
assure the care and use of animals were followed according to the Animal Welfare Act regulations. Each reporting facility
shall submit an annual report, covering the use of live animals in the previous fiscal year, on or before December 1st of
each calendar year.
Correct by July 19, 2023.

One opened bag of dog food was stored on top of the refrigerator in the food storage room of the Junior-Senior Building.
Likewise, bottles of dishwashing liquid were stored on the countertops in the same food storage room. Failure to
appropriately store open supplies food and cleaning supplies can compromise the nutritive value of the food items
provided to the animals, as well as pose a threat to animal health. All open supplies of food and bedding must be kept in
leakproof containers with tightly fitted lids. Only food and bedding that is currently being used may be kept in the animal
areas. Substances that are toxic to the dogs but are required for normal husbandry practices must not be stored in food
storage and preparation areas, but may be stored in cabinets in the animal areas.
Correct by July 13, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the authorized person and facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.31(c) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
The facility’s IACUC did not review the facility's program for humane care and use of animals, inspect the animal facilities, 
and submit reports to the Institutional Official at the required frequency of at least once every six months. The facility 
conducted their semi-annual IACUC reviews and inspections in January 2022 and May 2023, which occurred at a 16-
month interval. These IACUC functions are necessary to ensure appropriate oversight of the care and use of animals 
involved in research activities. The IACUC must review their program, inspect their animal facilities, and report the 
findings to the Institutional Official at least once every six months. 
Correct by November 24, 2023. 
2.36(a) 
   
Annual report. 
The facility's annual report for the previous 2022 federal fiscal year was not submitted by the required deadline of 
December 1 to the Deputy Administrator. The facility submitted their annual report on May 25, 2023. Appropriate 
submission of the annual report in a timely manner is essential to evaluate the information provided in the reports and 
assure the care and use of animals were followed according to the Animal Welfare Act regulations. Each reporting facility 
shall submit an annual report, covering the use of live animals in the previous fiscal year, on or before December 1st of 
each calendar year. 
Correct by July 19, 2023. 
3.1(e) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
One opened bag of dog food was stored on top of the refrigerator in the food storage room of the Junior-Senior Building. 
Likewise, bottles of dishwashing liquid were stored on the countertops in the same food storage room. Failure to 
appropriately store open supplies food and cleaning supplies can compromise the nutritive value of the food items 
provided to the animals, as well as pose a threat to animal health. All open supplies of food and bedding must be kept in 
leakproof containers with tightly fitted lids. Only food and bedding that is currently being used may be kept in the animal 
areas. Substances that are toxic to the dogs but are required for normal husbandry practices must not be stored in food 
storage and preparation areas, but may be stored in cabinets in the animal areas. 
Correct by July 13, 2023.

This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the authorized person and facility representatives.
